intro: Spondioides ferrugineum, commonly known as the rusty spondias, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish-orange flowers that appear in spring. The fruit is a small, round drupe that turns red when mature. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, wooded areas. The plant has a moderate growth rate and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
